title: Duplicate table+chair seating set 3x on the right side in both full and fallback 3D cafe scenes

requirements.summary: Add 3 duplicated table+4-chair seating sets to the right side (positive X) of the full CafeEnvironment scene without overlaps and with chairs facing their table.
acceptanceCriteria: CafeEnvironment renders the original seating set plus 3 additional duplicated seating sets (total 4 table+chair sets).
All 3 new seating sets are placed on the right side of the room (positive X) and are visibly separated (no z-fighting/overlap) from each other and from existing props.
For each new seating set, all 4 chairs are rotated to face toward their corresponding table (matching the current orientation behavior of the original set).

file_operations.description: Duplicate the existing CafeTable + 4 WoodenChair arrangement three times and place the new sets on the positive-X (right) side of the room (e.g., tables around x≈5–6 with spaced z positions), ensuring clear gaps from the right wall (x=8 wall mesh), from the existing center seating set, and from other props (e.g., wall art at x≈7.85, z≈3) to avoid overlap/z-fighting; keep chair positions relative to each table and preserve rotations (front chairs rotation=0, back chairs rotation=Math.PI) so all chairs face their corresponding table.

requirements.summary: Add 3 duplicated table+4-chair seating sets to the right side (positive X) of the BasicCafeRoomFallback scene without overlaps and with chairs facing their table.
acceptanceCriteria: BasicCafeRoomFallback renders the original seating set plus 3 additional duplicated seating sets (total 4 table+chair sets).
All 3 new seating sets are placed on the right side of the fallback room (positive X) with no visible overlaps.
For each new seating set, all 4 chairs face toward their corresponding table.

file_operations.description: Duplicate the existing CafeTable + 4 WoodenChair arrangement three times and place the new sets on the positive-X (right) side of the fallback room (e.g., tables around x≈6–7 with spaced z positions), ensuring clear gaps from the right wall (x=10 wall mesh), from the existing center seating set, and from counter-area objects to avoid visible overlaps; keep chair offsets relative to each table and preserve rotations (front chairs rotation=0, back chairs rotation=Math.PI) so all chairs face their corresponding table.
